com.idevicesinc.sweetblue

Class BleDevice.WriteBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.idevicesinc.sweetblue.BleDevice.WriteBuilder
  • Enclosing class:
    BleDevice
    Deprecated. 
    - Use WriteBuilder instead. This will be removed in v 3.0

    @Deprecated
public static class BleDevice.WriteBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
    Builder class for sending a write over BLE. Use this class to set the service and/or characteristic UUIDs, and the data you'd like to write. This class provides convenience methods for sending booleans, ints, shorts, longs, and Strings. Use with BleDevice.write(WriteBuilder), or BleDevice.write(WriteBuilder, ReadWriteListener).

    • Constructor Detail

      • WriteBuilder

        public WriteBuilder()
        Deprecated. 
        Basic constructor. You must at the very least call setCharacteristicUUID(UUID), and one of the methods that add data (setBytes(byte[]), setInt(int), etc..) before attempting to send the write.

      • WriteBuilder

        public WriteBuilder(boolean isBigEndian)
        Deprecated. 
        Overload of BleDevice.WriteBuilder(boolean, UUID, UUID). If @param isBigEndian is true,
        Parameters:
        isBigEndian - - if true, then when using setInt(int), setShort(short), or setLong(long), SweetBlue will reverse the bytes for you.

      • setServiceUUID

        public final BleDevice.WriteBuilder setServiceUUID(java.util.UUID uuid)

        Set the service UUID for this write. This is only needed when you have characteristics with identical uuids under different services.

      • setString

        public final BleDevice.WriteBuilder setString(java.lang.String value,
                                              java.lang.String stringEncoding)
        Deprecated. 
        Set a string to be written. This method also allows you to specify the string encoding. If the encoding fails, then String.getBytes() is used instead, which uses "UTF-8" by default.

      • setString

        public final BleDevice.WriteBuilder setString(java.lang.String value)
        Deprecated. 
        Set a string to be written. This defaults to "UTF-8" encoding.
